alert.note: Alert for Coastal Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 15 at 12:13PM EST until November 17 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected up to 2.5 feet. * WHERE...Coastal Gulf County. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Thursday night. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from noon EST /11 AM CST/ today to 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is possible. Up to 2 feet of inundation is possible on normally dry ground near the shoreline. The main high tide of concern will come late this evening.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
